author: mrmitch
title: Wheelbarrel and Bob makes this set.
review: My very young set went threw a Bob the Builder phase and this happened to show up in his stocking at Christmas time. The figure is the main reason to consider this set, I do like the wheelbarrel too. His hands can be snapped onto the handles with a little bit of skill. Some of the blocks are printed on one side which the little ones seem to like.

author: CharlieTheFunEngine
title: TinyTurbosCityAndToyStory Reviews Episode 8: Bob's Workshop
review:
I had been building with my dad's old LEGO from his younger years a lot and decided I wanted some of my own. I ended up with this.

Building Experience:

You put together a few bricks, and not only that, they're oversized. I'm sure I enjoyed it back then though.

Parts:

No complaints here, this is still only Duplo set I have.

Playability:

Oh come on. You can't even take Bob or the wheelbarrow apart.

Value for Money:

I think I paid AUD$7 for this in 2001. I would never pay that much for a set like this now.

Overall:

Hey, it's okay. But it's not worth AUD$7, even if it was regular LEGO bricks.
